review_title: FRMC - A Great Place to Work
job_title: Systems Analyst II in Sandusky, OH
pros:
The salary and benefits were great.

The IS department, consisting of the Service Desk, Infrastructure, IS Security, Clinical Systems, and Project Management included close to 50 people.
With very few exceptions, the IS department is staffed by knowledgeable, friendly, caring, hard-working professionals.

For the most part, the clinicians did not treat the IS staff as underlings.
We were treated with dignity and respect and it made the work much more enjoyable.
cons:
The IS department was understaffed for the workload we carried, but the managers were / are working to increase personnel allocations.

About every 4 to 6 weeks we'd have to work an overnight turnaround for server maintenance; but, it was to be expected when you work for a hospital with server-based patient care systems.

review_title: Poor management, bottom of the barrel salaries, and sub-par clinical professionals.
pros: Proximity to home, if you happen to live locally. Affordable health insurance, average to below average benefit package.
cons:
Uneducated management and leadership, misleading information given during interviews, high school female antics on a daily basis, including female management. You could throw a rock in any direction and find far-superior pay. Clinical professionals are educationally lacking. Antiquated attendance policy. Many disgruntled employees. Poor employee incentive and merit-based programs. There is little-to-no diversity, especially within clinical and managerial fields.
It's worth the commute to find a little bit of happiness from your job- by all means, go elsewhere.

review_title: Very exciting when first starting to work there, then down hill after.
pros: Benefits immediately after hire, good networking, fun perks while working like baseball Fridays and popcorn.
cons: Very short staffed in every department. I got tricked into thinking I was going to do administrative work, however after a month on the job I was doing nurses aid work (I have a 4 year degree). There is no room for advancement unless you want to become a nurse.

pros: Patients in area are great to care for! Clean facility in general. Better Hospital than FTMC.
cons: Upper management very inconsiderate of employees. Some higher ups dont care whatsorver.Unless your related to someone or a friend. Otherwise your replaceable and they do replace you. I've seen Supervisors lie and make promises and take advantage of some to coddle to others they know. If you stand up for yourself you get pushed out and HR dosnt help you.

job_title: Senior Marketing Content Specialist in Aliso Viejo, CA
pros: work from home, structured sales environment, great product, and has great potential
cons: work from home, marketing direction is off, value quantity or quality, communication could use some work considering 80% of the employee base works from home.

pros: The hospital itself is nice, and is in the process of being updated. The benefits were good.
cons: ER Charge Nurses not welcoming to new staff, and make a point of showing it. Not only could Charge Nurses be unprofessional to co-workers but patients and family members as well. Management seems to be aware and unconcerned of the poor attitudes and high turnover rates. Pay is not good. Often enforce mandatory extra shifts for months at a time due to high turnover rates.

review_title: Good Organization with  a Few Misplaced Supervisors
pros: Employee recognition, benefits for part-timers,  good use of technology, some really dedicated employees who love their job and are focused on doing their best for the common good. Nurses are great.
cons: Antiquated attendance policy, a few employees in power who are burned out, sarcastic, negative, and draw down morale

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Sandusky, OH

cons: Pay is very low and they are always short staffed.  If you are promoted, it can take months to get into your new position.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Sandusky, OH

cons: There is a lot of turn over for one reason or another. It feels like forever for them to make decisions or turn decisions into action.

pros: Knowledgeable nurses; caring, friendly staff; nurse managers that care; Senior administration speaks to staff and acknowledges their concerns; encourage nurses to continue education
cons: Pay could be more in line with neighboring hospitals; night shift is often overlooked or negliected, the parking garage is dangerous.

pros: Great people to be around all week, job was somewhat flexible, the PTOs and sick time were good.
cons: Pay wasn't that great. Sometimes they would expect you to work after you clocked out or expected you to work more hours in a week than you were hired for.
